page.title: 14Conservation N.E. of Mynd
page.content: Interest in conservation appears to be widespread.The National Trust owns hill land near Holly Cottage,Womerton and in the Gogbatch,thus ensuring that this land is protected.The farming community is interested in maintaining hedgerows and woodland and trees are planted to replace those that are felled. In the villages, many old houses are either well maintained or have been sympathetically restored.The Pound Inn the only thatched building in the area has recently been re-thatched.The churches are also well maintained. Public footpaths,although not often signposted,are kept open,but farmers complain that walkers stray from paths and damage hedges. Professional conservationists are viewed with some suspicion and villagers are wary of over-development.
